Definition: We'd want you to evaluate the QUALITY of each of the following arguments (discussing the Gun Control) and decide whether or not they're legitimate. A good argument is easily understood and presents an argument, a premise, or a conclusion that may be utilized in a gun control argument. A sentence that can't be understood as an argument or that isn't about the gun control is an invalid argument.

We'd want you to evaluate the QUALITY of each of the following arguments (discussing the Gun Control) and decide whether or not the argument is legitimate. A valid argument is easily interpreted and presents an argument, a premise, or a conclusion that may be utilized in a gun control argument. A remark that cannot be construed as an argument or that is not on the issue of the gun control is referred to as an invalid argument.

We'd want you to evaluate the QUALITY of each of the following arguments (discussing the Gun Control) and decide whether or not they're valid. A valid argument is easily understood and provides an argument, a premise, or a conclusion that can be utilized in a gun control argument. A phrase that can't be construed as an argument or that isn't about the gun control is an invalid argument.

For this task, you will evaluate the quality of arguments pertaining to Gun Control and decide the validity of the argument. Good arguments are those that are easily comprehended and provides valid facts that can be utilized in debate. Bad arguments are not relevant to the topic and cannot be utilized for debates.

Positive Examples.input: So tell me Brady, exactly what gun control laws HAVE saved lives.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a valid argument since it questions whether gun control laws have actually saved lives.

Positive Examples.input: Even in the Emerson case although the court recognized the Second Amendment as protecting an individual right they didn't apply strict scrutiny (something that would be required if they were dealing with a fundamental right).
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a valid argument since it factually states that fundamental rights are often not strictly scrutinized.

Positive Examples.input: "to keep and bear Arms" - this would include any gun
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example since the literal translation of the quote is the statement of the argument.

Positive Examples.input: The failure to conduct a NICS check would be a felony for licensees and nonlicensees.
Positive Examples.explanation: this is a good example since it argues that any failure to conduct checks are felonies w.r.t gun ownership.

Negative Examples.input: I work in the mental health field and there are many people that I work with that guns should be absoultely kept away.
Negative Examples.explanation: The answer here should be valid since the person argues that they have the expertise and can recommend against gun control.

Negative Examples.input: You will go to your grave trying for more and more and even more gun control.
Negative Examples.explanation: This is not a good example since the argument states that gun control legislation takes time and as such provides a valid statement.

Negative Examples.input: This is akin to someone learning the value of hard work while working at a fast food place and then applying that value when they work professionally as a furniture maker.
